intro: Dalechampia falcata, commonly known as the sickle-leaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and diverse growth forms. The plant is characterized by its elongated, sickle-shaped leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia falcata is often found in moist, wooded areas and can be an indicator species for certain wetland habitats.
